what: Supporting Materials for Data and Culture Course
title: Supporting Materials for Data and Culture Course
text: R package supplies example data labs introductory general-audience course, “Data Culture” (359:207) co-taught Prof. Meredith McGill Rutgers University, New Brunswick Fall 2022. course syllabus slides data-analysis presentations can downloaded dc22.andrewgoldstone.com/slides. labs also available, together supplementary blog posts data discussed course included package, dc22.andrewgoldstone.com. major themes data-analysis part course : cultural tastes time (social) space text-mining fiction problem genre historical fictional social networks Anyone course welcome reuse remix datasets (well associated pedagogical material). tried document data detail online R help. brief summary: 48,032 recipes 74 American cookbooks, 1803–1922, tabulated ingredients ethnic geographic origins recipes (recipes). Source: Feeding America, via Folgert Karsdorp et al., Humanities Data Analysis: Case Studies Python New babies’ first names United States, nationally state (recent_ssa_names, recent_ssa_state_names). variables cover 2016–2020, supplementing first-name data babynames ukbabynames packages (also used course). Source: U.S. Social Security Administration. Survey data Americans’ musical tastes (gssmusic), 1993 General Social Survey Culture Module. Source: GSS, via Kieran Healy’s gssr package. Ted Underwood’s corpus English-language fiction associated subgenre labels (genre_meta, genre_features). data cover 1047 British American novels 1760–1989, extensive metadata volume. Underwood designed corpus study differences genre labels like science fiction crime fiction assigned various hands “random” baseline set novels. class exercises partially replicating analysis, reformatted original replication data convenient processing R. Source: Underwood’s replication repository Distant Horizons: Digital Evidence Literary Change (University Chicago Press, 2021). Character interactions Hamlet (hamlet). Automatically extracted New Folger XML text, support network analysis play. Source: New Folger Shakespeare Library, Karsdorp et al.’s Humanities Data Analysis. networks revolutionary Boston (ggraph::whigs). Secret society memberships members Boston’s Whig activists eve American Revolution. Sir Appearing Package, ggraph package, taught course, includes dataset, created Kieran Healy basis work historian David Hackett Fischer. data-raw directory contains R code demonstrating obtained formatted R objects included data. pedagogical purposes found useful include R packages teaching labs dependencies package. way required R packages course installed follows: R-development purposes, removed “excess” dependencies anyone wants package just dataset doesn’t install entire tidyverse fairly heavyweight igraph ggraph packages. recommend teaching Tidyverse first, last, always. grateful Meredith McGill, co-taught 359:207 , well students, never explicitly said didn’t want test subjects. Andrew Goldstone, July 2023

title: Speaker interactions in Hamlet — hamlet
text: Speaker interactions Shakespeare's Hamlet. Two characters recorded interacting one speaks directly another within scene play. X speaking Y counted Y speaking X. Data extracted XML version New Folger Library Edition Hamlet (conflated text play) following method demonstrated Karsdorp et al.'s Humanities Data Analysis.

title: Speaker interactions in Hamlet — hamlet
Speaker interactions in Hamlet — hamlet
text: data frame 140 rows 5 columns s1 first speaker interaction, alphabetically s2 second speaker interaction, alphabetically act act number play pair appears scene scene number play pair appears turns number times either speaks act scene

title: Speaker interactions in Hamlet — hamlet
text: https://shakespeare.folger.edu/shakespeares-works/hamlet/download/. New Folger Shakespeare available CC--NC 3.0 license. algorithm extracting interactions based Folgert Karsdorp et al., Humanities Data Analysis: Case Studies Python (Princeton University Press, 2021), chap. 2.

title: Speaker interactions in Hamlet — hamlet
text: Speaker identifications extracted attributes sp speech-heading tags, leading # trailing _Ham removed.

title: Historic American Cookbook Recipes Data — recipes
text: Slightly reprocessed accompanying data Folgert Karsdorp et al., Humanities Data Analysis: Case Studies Python (Princeton University Press, 2021), chap. 1. Karsdorp et al. prepared CSV file containing preprocessed recipe data derived XML-encoded cookbooks Feeding America: Historic American Cookbook Dataset (East Lansing: Michigan State University Libraries Stephen O. Murray Keelung Hong Special Collections), 2003, https://lib.msu.edu/feedingamericadata. CSV file represented tbl_df object . Recipe data derived editorial markup: Feeding America editors marked recipe ingredients assigned recipes ethnic, meal-stage, regional categories. categories recorded unmodified .
